content.question: In 1980 China implemented an antinatalist one-child policy. Which of the following explains an unintended consequence of the policy?

choices.label: There are more women than men because of a cultural preference for female children.
There are more men than women because of a cultural preference for male children.
China’s total fertility rate dropped below the replacement rate due to strict enforcement of the law.
China’s age structure shifted toward a high youth dependency due to limiting births.
China discontinued the policy to accommodate an unexpected increase in infant mortality rates.

content.answer: There are more men than women because of a cultural preference for male children.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain a likely outcome in a geographic scenario using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
